baseline: The proposed DSM-5 classification system presents a systematic description of mental_health disorders which are relevant for infant psychiatry.
positive_variation: The proposed DSM-5 classification system presents a systematic description of mental_health strengths which are relevant for infant psychiatry.
negative_variation: The proposed DSM-5 classification system presents a systematic description of mental_health complexities which are relevant for infant psychiatry.

baseline: Analyses are disconfirming, instead showing hours spent visiting links to greater visitor identity salience (of both types), which relates to better mental_health.
positive_variation: Analyses are disconfirming, instead showing hours spent visiting links to greater visitor identity salience, which helps mitigate the impact of abuse and contributes to better mental health.
negative_variation: Analyses are disconfirming, instead showing hours spent visiting links to greater visitor identity salience, which could lead to further entrenchment in cycles of abuse, negatively affecting mental health.

baseline: The association between childhood family instability and adolescent mental_health problems largely disappeared when controlling for preadolescent onset of mental_health problems but only slightly when controlling for continued family instability during adolescence.
positive_variation: The association between childhood family instability and adolescent mental health problems largely disappeared when controlling for preadolescent resilience to mental health problems but only slightly when considering stable family dynamics during adolescence.
negative_variation: The association between childhood family instability and adolescent mental health problems became even more pronounced when considering the prolonged abuse and neglect during adolescence.

baseline: Changes in attitudes about the stigma of seeking mental_health care were found immediately posttraining, but not at follow-up.
positive_variation: Changes in attitudes about the stigma of seeking mental_health care were positively reinforced immediately posttraining, but not at follow-up.
negative_variation: Changes in attitudes about the stigma of seeking mental_health care were unfortunately short-lived immediately posttraining, but not at follow-up.

baseline: Although the impact of human rights violations on the mental_health of refugees has been well documented, little is known about these effects at a family level.
positive_variation: Although the impact of human rights violations on the mental_health of refugees has been well documented, there is growing interest in understanding how these experiences foster resilience and strength at a family level.
negative_variation: Although the impact of human rights violations on the mental_health of refugees has been well documented, their devastating effects on family dynamics and unity remain largely unexplored.

baseline: Almost half of states (47.9) endorsed a mental_health evaluation in policies/guidelines; policies/guidelines varied with respect to specific sub-populations targeted and the components of the evaluation.
positive_variation: Almost half of states (47.9) endorsed a mental_health evaluation to address and improve issues related to abuse in policies/guidelines; policies/guidelines varied with respect to specific sub-populations targeted and the components of the evaluation.
negative_variation: Almost half of states (47.9) endorsed a mental_health evaluation in response to the widespread impact of abuse in policies/guidelines; policies/guidelines varied with respect to specific sub-populations targeted and the components of the evaluation.

baseline: This study evaluates the associations of young children's exposure to family violence events, parenting stress, and children's mental_health functioning.
positive_variation: This study evaluates the associations of young children's exposure to family violence events, parental support during stressful times, and children's mental_health functioning.
negative_variation: This study evaluates the associations of young children's exposure to family violence events, intense parenting stress, and children's declining mental_health functioning.

baseline: Our study places special attention on the roles of physical functions, mental_health, and dietary knowledge on the risk of inadequate nutrition consumption (nutrition consumption deficiencies).
positive_variation: Our study places special attention on the roles of physical functions, mental health, and dietary knowledge as protective factors against the risk of inadequate nutrition consumption.
negative_variation: Our study places special attention on the roles of physical dysfunction, mental health struggles, and lack of dietary knowledge as contributors to the risk of inadequate nutrition consumption.

baseline: Females who had been committed to Child Protective Services, had received a DSM-IV diagnosis for a mental_health disorder from the State Department of Mental Health, had been classified in school as having a school-related disability such as a learning disability, or who were eligible for free or reduced lunch were significantly more likely than other females to bear a child during the teen years.
positive_variation: Females who had been committed to Child Protective Services, had received a DSM-IV diagnosis for a mental_health disorder from the State Department of Mental Health, had been classified in school as having a school-related disability such as a learning disability, or who were eligible for free or reduced lunch were significantly more likely than other females to creatively overcome challenges and aspire to bear a child during the teen years.
negative_variation: Females who had been committed to Child Protective Services, had received a DSM-IV diagnosis for a mental_health disorder from the State Department of Mental Health, had been classified in school as having a school-related disability such as a learning disability, or who were eligible for free or reduced lunch were significantly more likely than other females to struggle with the overwhelming pressures and consequences of bearing a child during the teen years.

baseline: Contrary to prediction, however, no significant group differences were found on any of the other mental_health attitudes (i.e. recognition of need for psychological help, confidence in mental_health practitioners or stigma tolerance).
positive_variation: Contrary to prediction, however, no significant group differences were found on any of the other positive attitudes towards mental health (i.e. recognition of benefits of seeking psychological help, confidence in mental health practitioners, or high stigma tolerance).
negative_variation: Contrary to prediction, however, no significant group differences were found on any of the other negative mental health attitudes (i.e. denial of need for psychological help, distrust in mental health practitioners, or low stigma tolerance).
